name: Indoor Grilling: Beer-Braised Ribs
description: "These ribs were tender with a richness of flavors from the beer, cinnamon, ginger, garlic, and chilies in the braise." [Photograph: Joshua Bousel] Although grilling is most definitely a year-round practice in my household, when the cold and dark arrive,...
recipeIngredient: 1 rack pork loin back ribs, around 3 pounds
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
10 nickel-sized slices unpeeled fresh ginger or 1 tablespoon ground ginger
5 dried red chilies or a teaspoon of cayenne
1 bottle dark beer, like Guinness or any porter

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 300°F. Remove the membrane from the bottom side of the ribs and split the rack into two. Season liberally with salt and pepper. Put oil in a large, deep ovenproof skillet or casserole that can later be covered. Turn heat to medium-high and, when oil shimmers, sear meat on both sides until nicely browned, turning as necessary.
Add allspice, cinnamon, ginger, chilies and garlic and stir; add beer. Bring to a boil; cover pan and adjust heat so mixture simmers steadily. Put in oven and cook until meat is tender, about 1 hour.

Heat broiler. Drain meat and sprinkle it with salt and pepper. Broil on both sides until brown and crisp, about 1 to 2 minutes. Meanwhile, skim cooking liquid of fat, bring to a boil, and use as sauce.
